desc: Excellent hotel with perfect location. Great team of people with excellent customer service too. They will go an extra mile to delight their customers, executive club members evening will start from 18.00-20.00 with good choices of drinks & very testy food too.

title: Great hotel for first time in Singapore
desc: First time in Singapore, great stay at this hotel. Room was very large, comfortable and well-appointed. Staff was friendly and helpful. Good buffed breakfast. Excellent location- across street from Raffles hotel, near multiple subway lines and an easy walk to most of the museums and attractions we wanted to visit. Hope to be back soon.

title: Nice hotel to visit Singapore
desc: That’s a great option for both family or business trip. Convenient location, with great vicinity to down town and other activities. Rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast- delicious with great selection of whatever you like. Despite the early bird reservation it’s still be costly. Anyhow I should say that this hotel is a fair option to stay in Singapore.

title: Business Hotel
desc: Stayed here for 5 nights in Oct22. Room is pretty big which is the best part of this hotel. Breakfast is quite chaotic between 8am and 9am, queue was a bit long on couple times. Hotel amenities is standard, nothing special. The hotel is close to Raffle city so you can easily find good foods.

title: Excellent location with great rooms
desc: The Carlton Hotel has the distinct advantage of being located in the near proximity of 3 MRT stations : City Hall (red line), Bugis (green line) and Bras Basah (orange line). Come out from any of these stations, and you'll see the imposing façade, hence its a place that is definitely un-missable, unless you choose to. Other benefits of being situated in such a great place is that everything you need and want can be found within easy walking distance, shopping and food at the Raffles City mall across the road or at Suntec further afield, bars and restaurants at Chijmes, and of course, the (overpriced and exaggerated) Singapore Sling at the Raffles Hotel Long Bar. Location is a A+++. Being in such an excellent place, it was no surprise that this a popular choice, so there was a

title: Fantastic stay at the Carlton, I would stay here again
desc: I came to Singapore for holiday in December 2022 and very impressed with my stay at the carlton. The staff were very hospitable and my room was fantastic. It was a big room with beautiful views of the city. I felt very safe here and staff were always on hand with any queries. I hope to come back to Singapore at the end of the year and will come back to the Carlton.

title: Highly recommend!
desc: Fantastic location. Staff were excellent. Great facilities. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and very comfortable. Would definitely recommend it to everyone looking. Very pleased with my 3 night stay.

title: Great location, nice rooms, awesome breakfast buffet
desc: I'm sure there are plenty of great hotel locations throughout Singapore, but this worked perfectly for us. It is a block from the City Hall MRT station so getting here from the airport via the MRT was a breeze. There are a plethora of nearby restaurants, shopping, and nightlife places across the street or within a block. Fort Canning is an easy walk, and even the Merlion isn't terribly far to walk. Our room was very nice, clean, and had everything needed. The breakfast buffet was quite large and extensive. The only curiousities that perplexed us were the quality and quantity of towels (no washcloths) and shampoo/soap provided, as well as not having an option to check out via the smart tv. Were too busy doing other stuff to check out the pool or gym.

title: Great place to Stay and close to Everthing.
desc: Great Place to stay in Singapore, Close to a lot of Shopping and Eating Places. The Room was big and very comfortable, Breakfast was good, a big selection of food on offer. But like most things in Singapore these days not cheap, but still really good.

title: Close to everything
desc: I thought this hotel offered very good value , and it had everything I needed for a one-night stay. It is opposite Raffles and a couple of big Shopping Centres..so easy to be entertained and close to the important things in life! Clean, quiet, safe and comparitively cheap

title: Convenience/Central Location
desc: Super friendly staff....clean rooms and convenient location/centrally located in Singapore. This place is located close to Bugis Street Junction and across the street from the ruffles hotel. Will definitely recommend this place

title: A great hotel in a good location
desc: We were very pleased with our stay. We arrived at 9.30am on New Years Day after a 14-hour flight from the UK, and an upgraded room was allocated in the Premier wing just after 10am so we were able to have a couple of hours sleep. The hotel location is good and the food in restaurant was very good. The only bar we found was closed throughout our stay. There are quite a few outdoor bars and restaurants in the complex opposite the hotel and an indoor shopping centre at nearby City Hall (with more eateries in the basement). The MRT (underground metro) runs from the shopping centre and we purchased a 2-day unlimited Tourist travel card for $26 each, with a $10 refund for returning the card at the end of Day 2. The pool was quite cold, which was surprisingly as the outside air

title: Great Hotel Close to Everything
desc: Just had a few days in Singapore, the hotel was close to everything and in walking distance to all the restaurants and shopping. The rooms were big and comfortable.. Beds were good , facilities in the room were good. Well worth staying at this hotel. Pool looked good, it was raining so didn’t get to use it … Breakfast was good and lots available.. highly recommend this hotel

title: Good property in a great location
desc: Recently stayed at Carlton Singapore with my wife. Was given a room in the older wing of the hotel and which is noticeably different. Reception was friendly upon arrival and departure procedure was prompt and courteous. Overall, great location and good service for the rate paid.

title: OK
desc: Stayed for 4 nights, hotel is in a great location and worthy of a 3.5 rating but trip advisor doesn’t allow that and in our opinion not quite worth a 4. The lobby is beautiful and smells great as you enter and the breakfast is good with a reasonable spread of different items. Had a room in the premier wing and the view over Raffles hotel and onward towards Marina Bay Sands hotel was good. The room smelled strange every time we entered with a kind of weird musty smell which was quite off putting and never went away during our visit. Two out of three days the tea and coffee was not replenished and there are no spoons in the room just wooden stirrers which feels a bit cheap. One day we came back to no soap or hand washing products in the room at all and had to ring housekeeping

title: Strategically located hotel.
desc: It was a good stay for us. We booked 2 rooms for a total of 4 persons for 4 nights. I was lucky since one of our room is located across Raffless Hotel. Our window’s view is nice. Room is fairly good and clean. Location is very strategic, close to Raffless City Mall, Bugis area and within walking distance to Suntec City and The National Museum of Singapore. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here.

title: Classy Carlton
desc: We came off a very long flight and this hotel was a real sight for sore eyes. It’s big and modern and just perfect. We had a wonderful view, there were plenty of lights and black out blinds. Excellent facilités. We had two nights here and really couldn’t have asked for more. It’s in the centre of lots of sites and across the road from the beautiful Raffles hotel. Would highly recommend and would stay again.

title: Amazing customer service
desc: We were supposed to stay at Carlton Singapore Hotel for 4 days before boarding on a cruise. My husband ended up at the hospital the second night in Singapore then went in to emergency surgery two nights later. What a nightmare! During this chaos and difficult time , being alone in a foreign country and facing all the uncertainty... the hotel manager, Thamar and the concierge (Victor) helped me with the extended stay, and offered me their services with my insurance papers, all the day to day needs to help ease my mental distress and pains that I was going through. We ended up staying at this hotel for two weeks. It felt like home and Victor & Thamar made me feel they are part of my family! I truly appreciate the services they provided me and my husband and so touched by their

title: COMFORTABLE WITHOUT BEING OUTSTANDING
desc: Its foyer is the more traditional polished marble and it looks quite impressive. Check-in arrangements were very seamless This is a large multi-storey hotel essentially in the heart of the CBD. We were allocated room number 2419, obviously on the 24th floor. The view from the room was over the CBD and was reasonably impressive. Overall rating of 3 1/2 would be appropriate, but is that is not possible would rate it four At a cost of approximately $350 per night it was not inexpensive but overall, given the costs of hotels in Singapore it was reasonable. The room it’s self was nice enough but essentially just a motel room with most of the essentials. It was rather disappointing that although provisions had been made for a cup or tea,there was no milk or biscuits provided.

title: Great Location
desc: The hotel was at a great location in Singapore with close proximity to a shopping centre and shops. The rooms were clean and staff were friendly on both check in and check out. Buffet at breakfast also had a great variety to choose from.

title: Location, Location, Location
desc: Really impressed by this hotel from check-in to check-out. Spotlessly clean with efficient and friendly staff. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food other than the price of breakfast was very expensive. The big plus is the location - convenient to the MRT and central to many attractions. Would use again.

title: Great Place to Stay for Business in Singapore
desc: I think this hotel is a great place to stay for a business trip to Singapore. The place is big, clean and well-staffed. Check-in was smooth and staff was always available to help. Breakfast buffet is really nice. My room was large and very comfortable. Always clean. Room service was quick. Getting a taxi in Singapore was not easy without an app, but the hotel always had one for us within minutes. The location of the hotel is wonderful. It is across the street from the Raffles Hotel, Raffles City and a few minutes walk over to the river side restaurant areas. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Ok busy business hotel
desc: Carlton Hotel is a busy business hotel. The location of the hotel is great, it's right next to Raffels Hotel and City Hall, and walking distance to many places the business district, and tourist areas. The hotel corridor was musty, and the room was musty and dark as well, and some previous guests kept durian in the fridge, so it smelled a bit. The shower pressure wasn't good either. But otherwise it was a comfortable stay. Staff were friendly.

title: Perfect location to explore the city
desc: First off we stayed in the deluxe room, this was perfect, large bed & very comfortable, decent size room with a fridge, and a large bathroom with a bath & separate shower. We had breakfast included, and there was so much choice, I loved the omelettes. Also you were given a little sign that said this table is taken which was a good idea, and another good idea was using your room key to operate the lift. This hotel is close to a few MRT stations, so wherever you wanted to go it was no problem. Their MRT were so easy to use, clean and cheap. Also the bus service, again cheap & easy to use. If you fancied a walk, there were plenty of place near by, we walked back from Marina Bay one night, as it was a bit cooler then. My only gripe about this hotel was that it did not have a

title: Great location for walking to most things.
desc: Very happy with our stay at the Carlton. Check in was fast and efficient. The rooms have everything you need. The gym has the gear you would want , but can be busy at 0700hrs in the morning. The fellas in the foyer getting the taxis are very friendly and only had to wait a couple of minutes. The location is awesome, you can walk to most attractions and most things are only 20 minutes. If you want some cheap Tucker go over to the raffles City shops. The 3rd floor has a cheap food court. Or the chijmes is also right across the street. I would stay again at the hotel,

title: Not as good as expected
desc: I was excited to stay at this hotel. The entrance is stunning and looks like a classy place. It does have a lot of nice features but is not quite the complete package. Pros - higher end design and appearance, fast elevators, nice lighting throughout and in the room, very comfortable bed Cons - bathroom is very open to share with a friend. Comforter was overly warm and A/C did not get the room cool enough. No sheet or lighter blanket option, only the very warm comforter. The shower stall has a door that is so close to the floor that the bath mat gets caught on it and basically doesn't work. The breakfast buffet has lots of food options but it was very busy and noisy. You have to negotiate people coming at you from all directions just to serve yourself some food and return

title: Good for the price, but there are better hotels.
desc: Pretty good, upmarket and clean room. Great breakfast. Some issues: shower doesn’t get hot, just mildly warm - my colleagues all had this issue. The neighbouring room has a connecting door which meant I could hear everything next door. Both bars never opened.

title: Lovely hotel shocking breakfast
desc: The hotel is lovely , clean spacious rooms but sadly the breakfast we have just had 28th Feb was shocking , yes I know they are cooking for the masses , but really trying to fob us off with pre made omelette and pre fried eggs , after we sent them back the second omelette had more liquid egg than cooked , cold hash browns ! Just glad I hadn’t booked here for a full vacation

title: Nice business hotel.
desc: Room was updated and nice amenities for a business type hotel. Nothing fancy but everything you’d want was in the hotel. Breakfast is very busy but lots of staff to take care of the plates and food was hit and tasty. Front desk team very helpful and offers good suggestions on lunch and dinner spots. Raffles mall across the street as well as Chimjes makes location a plus

title: Great location, price.
desc: Great location near civic center and financial center. One can even walk to Chinatown. A metro station next to it as well as big mall and plenty of restaurants and shops. Room was up to date with modern decor and convient shower and toilet. Clean. Uncluttered. Good buffet included. Service correct and friendly by almost all. Porter excellent on arrival and departure. Plan to stay again.

title: Extremely poor at helping disabled guests access breakfast.
desc: I'm part of a disabled theatre company. We stayed two nights outbound and retuning from Sydney. On our return, as a treat, we wanted to have the buffet breakfast, but because of Disability Access needs, we needed to reserve a table. We were told this was impossible straightaway. We explained why it was important, but were refused again. So, we tried to see the Duty Manager. They wouldn't talk to us. We were told to go elsewhere, as the restaurant would be busy. There was no attempt to understand or help made by any of the employees. In total, four people stayed outbound, two on the way back. We won't stay again.

title: Great hotel in excellent location
desc: Spent 7 nights here and had a great time. Lovely big, clean room with everything you could need. Fridge, safe and cold air con. Lovely comfortable, big bed and powerful shower. Breakfast was good to with plenty of choice. Location was excellent right next to Raffles hotel and 5 minutes from MRT. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again and would definitely recommend

title: Had a very good experience! Awsome location, clean and spacious rooms
desc: We has a very good experience, we got to the hotel at 9:00am and they gave us early check in with no extra cost, our room was spotless, the hotels also offers an excellent location with a los of restaurants and shopping nearby, and many walkable tourist sites.

title: The Place to Stay
desc: I love the staff, location and decor of this hotel. It is centrally located with shopping centers, daily tours routes and eateries. The staff at the hotel were professional. I am looking forward to staying here again on my return to Singapore.

title: Brilliant location
desc: A great location that is convenient to the local shopping centre with supermarket and food court. Only a short walk to the MRT. Facilities in the hotel are excellent. Great restaurants across the road at CHIJMES.

title: No room service menus
desc: A decent hotel in a good location. But has a few drawbacks. Soundproofing not good, street noise can be clearly heard. The worst aspect is room service. The menu and other information is only available online and neither of my devices could load it! How hard is it to provide a book with services and menus? They lost sales when I woke at 4am due to jet lag. The staff were so disinterested and unhelpful that I had to go out of the hotel and hunt around for coffee and food. Not easy in a city which doesn't seem to wake up until 8am at the earliest.

title: Clean and comfortable city hotel in a good location
desc: Excellent location, clean and comfortable. Reasonably priced as we booked well in advance. Friendly staff who allowed us to use their changing facilities to freshen up as we arrived at the hotel after a long flight at 10am, which was too early to be able to check-in. This allowed us to get change clothes and shower into suitable clothing before heading out to explore Singapore.

title: Big well fitted but boring hotel
desc: It’s quite hard to justify this not being a five. The hotel is well fitted. Really it was just a bit vast and soulless. The room was big, modern and clean. It just liked some love or attention to detail in its design. It could use a decent coffee machine for example. The breakfast was busy, a lot of people crammed into a small area. Check in was super slow, I’m not sure why it takes them so long and they need to print and staple things in this I day and age.

title: DO NOT BOOK A CLUB ROOM. Very bad experience especially Front desk staff
desc: One of my worst experiences! Do not book a club room! They promise you breakfast in the club lounge but you had to have it in the main restaurant with hundreds of other customers. The executive lounge was only open for 2 hours in the evening. There is nothing special about the room. We spent 3 hours changing rooms and waiting for extra beds to be delivered, not ideal after a long flight. The front desk staff did not seem to care and the night duty manager would not come to talk to us. They just wanted to get rid of us. There are plenty of other decent hotels in Singapore, so please think carefully before booking at the Carlton.

title: Wouldn't stay here again
desc: Good location. Friendly staff. The room was quite tired and in need of decorating. Wasn't as clean as it should be with surfaces not cleaned properly and with food/drink remaining from previous guests. Bathroom did have mould on ceiling in shower area. So not ideal but okay. Restaurant is probably what really lets this place down though. Good food choice and well presented. But clearing staff are really focused on doing their job of clearing and not the customer experience. What I mean is it is really obvious that clearing stuff from your table is more important than being polite. I won't about this point as it will be obvious to anyone experiencing it. But biggest issue was the chef on the egg station who used tissues to wipe pouring sweat from his head, face, neck, arms and

title: The place to stay
desc: Centrally located in one of the best Cities in the world. We just loved the Carlton, great value for money and even better service to boot. Rooms were quiet and very comfortable and quite spacious for Singapore standards. The breakfast was amazing with one of the largest selections I have ever seen. From Asian to Western and everything in between. Great coffee and again service was phenomenal. We used the restuarant twice for dinner and had the friendliest maitre d possible. I only wish I could remember his name. He drove in from Malaysia every day and he is the best host we have ever experienced. With an early check out the staff ensured we had breakfast to take away with us so we didnt go hungry on the next leg of our trip. Please if youre going to Singapore have a look at the

title: Surprise package in Singapore
desc: I have not stayed here before but it won’t be my last time. Close to everything and a lively hotel and five star totally. I never got to the pool but the staff here are very good and friendly. Reception staff were a class act plus a lot of flight crew stay here too (which says a lot). Great hotel.

title: Great location and service
desc: Great location and beautiful lobby. Service was excellent from all staf with whom we had contact. When we first arrived I was surprised to find that the room, while large, was very bare. No art work or niceties that we are accustomed to in luxury type hotels. We had difficulty with getting hot water, the water pressure was really low and the tv remote was not working…probably batteries. We went to the front desk and were immediately transferred to a MUCH nicer room in the newer tower, which was more what we expected. There were a few other shortcomings, hence the 4 rating rather than 5. We had dinner one evening at the Mosaic restaurant which served an international buffet. It was a bit on the pricey side for what was offered. A much better choice was across the road

title: Good centrally located horel
desc: Great location. Had a nice room with lovely views, on the 25th floor. The only negative was the awful pillows! Good breakfast choices though very busy. We were surprised that there was no bar open in a hotel of this size. There was a bar there but it was not open. Pleasant and helpful staff.

title: Great location
desc: We booked into the Carlton Hotel for six nights. We were travelling with two other couples and all our rooms were different - different layout, different views. My wife and I were in the premier section with wonderful views straight down over the Raffles (just over the road) and across to Marina Bay Sands (the boat) and to the harbour area. And we had a window seat on which to perch. Our room was spacious with a large kingsize bed, desk and chair, lounge chair, tv, small fridge, coffee machine, wardrobe, iron, safe, etc. And free wifi which worked very well. We also had a bathroom with separate bath/shower area. Note - the shower was adjacent to the bath and worked well as far as pressure and hot water. The bathroom had White products (shampoo etc.) and was well laid

title: Great Location..Great Service
desc: This hotel is located in a great location! The hotel is in walkable to the Raffles City Mall and Chijmes Complex (many eateries)! The check-in/out went smoothly for our group! The accommodations were clean and spacious! The hotel’s staff were friendly and service was prompt! The floors were quiet and if you wanted to dine at the hotel..the restaurant at the hotel…Wah Lok has award winning Cantonese cuisine! I enjoyed my stay here at this hotel and highly recommend if you plan a visit to Singapore!

title: Best location
desc: Centrally located with the best views, Raffle city and Chijimes across the road and lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Buffet breakfast was very limited, mostly local dishes, however, room service was excellent with better variety. Lovely pool and gym are available for use during our stay. Thumb ups for the receptionist in charge who allowed us to have late check out due to late flight. You made our trip with a toddler so much easier. Really appreciate that. Highly recommended

title: Solid Business Hotel
desc: Very clean hotel. Pool area was on the small side. Gym was modern and well supplied. This hotel is perfect for business people as it is well located to most places of interest. Staff very efficient. Breakfast reasonably priced and wide selection of western food available. Would not recommend for families or children.

title: Great, convenient stay!
desc: We stayed 4 nights at the Carlton and had a great stay. The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable. It is opposite Raffles City Shopping Centre and MRT station which gives you plenty of options for eating,shopping & getting around Singapore on the metro. Would definitely stay again.

title: The best and awesome place to dine in
desc: Having a Birthday celebration for my mum at Mosaic Cafe. One of the manger Wan Ting bought us a complimentary mini Birthday cake to our surprise. Definitely an awesome nice gesture. Bravo to the staffs for being attentive and friendly. Will recommend friends. Thank You

title: Quality Hotel
desc: Checked into the Carlton on 17th April for 10 nights holiday. Booked a deluxe room and was given Room 2226. Room was spacious,clean and mini toiletries and water bottles provided daily. Bed was super comfortable with 4 good quality pillows.Room was promptly cleaned daily .Was perplexed with the amount of lighting in the bathroom, very dim and hard to apply makeup etcI ordered room service and was extremely disappointed with the meal. The waygu beef burger was under seasoned and under cooked. Bread roll was presented soggy ! However had buffet breakfast at Mosaic cafe and quality of food and beverages was very tasty. Expensive but well worth it for a treat. Must mention Magaswaran from the concierge desk who was extremely helpful and pleasant. Lovely gentleman and went out of his

title: a good hotel at a good price
desc: It calls itself upscale business which i think is accurate. Looks like my hilton’s and such. incredibly well located and good on line price (for singapore). raised to five stars because of great concierges who sent us to breakfast at best local kaya toast place and wonderful nearby hawker center. across the street from chijmes with fine restos and also a large mall of which singapore has many.

title: Soulless Hotel
desc: Soulless sterile hotel with no atmosphere and no bar. Tourists are not really welcomed, it is much more a business hotel and an overnight stop for flight crews. Breakfast buffet is ok but limited, there is nothing outstanding to note. Wold not stay again.

title: Excellent location and very clean
desc: Excellent location and incredibly clean. Grateful to receive interconnecting rooms and rollaway as requested to accommodate our family of 5. Staff polite and attentive. Great Pool. Would be great if it was available later than 7pm - we found that too early after arriving back late from JSSL Football tournament. Unfortunately Trainee who checked us in was very slow. It took far too long. It was around 1am our time and we just wanted a bed! Frustrated also requested rollaway was not already in the room awaiting our arrival. Had to be made up from Housekeeping and delivered to our room. Not sure why it wasn’t already done. Extra towel for 5th person wasn’t in room either and we had to request. We did very much enjoy our stay. The size of the rooms and hotel location are fantastic.

title: Very disappointing
desc: Location of the Hotel was in walking distance to Raffles and on bus routes. It's a shame hotel was disappointing, more for business men and women and a quick turn around. Hotel bed comfortable but room Valence dirty, carpet needed a good clean, extra toiletries in bathroom and water bottles refreshed every day. Breakfast eggs was left to get cold on top of counter, sausages were very pale did not look cooked, cereal was the same every morning corn flakes, bran flakes and looked like Coco pops, same with fruit. They have a coffee shop that shuts at 7.30pm, no bar in hotel have to go over the road to the bars. To be honest have stayed in better for the money charged. Too top it off on our last morning we saw the ladies of the night coming out of our hotel escorted by two

title: Great hotel good location
desc: Great hotel in good location. Recently updated so our room was great. The staff were very good. The breakfast was great with good selection. Will say the beds were very firm that said we did sleep better than we thought we would. Our room did have a view to the gardens by the bay from a distance. I'd stay there again for sure.

title: Great hotel, fab location - all is near!
desc: If you wish for the best located hotel, where all is within a walking distance, then this is the hotel. Not that fancy, but well equipped, with excellent and spacious room. There’re always water bottles in hand, always clean. Really good. We did not eat at the hotel, but surely, both Chijmes and the City Hall train station, and Raffles City huge mall is 2 minutes far away. If you are into longer walking - also Chinatown, and north bridge streets are well within your reach. Gym and trainer are great, well equipped!

title: Good position
desc: Carlton Hotel is well positioned in this part of the city. Easy access to most attractions, and a good feel to the area. Have stayed here before and would stay again. Great buffet breakfast to start your day.

title: Large, modern, clean room. Centrally located.
desc: Stayed one week in this hotel with my husband and my daughter. First of all, we mainly booked this hotel because of the size of the room in comparison to the price. Sure there are cheaper hotels but they are not suitable for family because of their small size. Here we have plenty of room for our suitcases and pram. The room is also nicely decorated, modern and clean with large bathroom. Bed is also large enough for 2 adults and 1 toddler. My daughter also really loves the bathtub! The location also could not be anymore perfect. It is centrally located and close to all the places we wanted to visit. The staff is really nice and they allowed us to have an early check in which is especially helpful if you have a cranky tired toddler. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would

title: Good for business travelers
desc: I stayed here on someone else's dime (work) so I can't really speak to value, but as a business traveler I can say that I would recommend it. So many hotels ignore the business traveler these days and don't provide a good desk or chair for working in your room. It's not the case with the Carlton. There's a nice, wide, desk with a real office chair and ample electrical outlets. The desk is in the window, so you have a nice view as you work away. The coffee is powdered, but I must say it's better than the majority of in-room coffee I have encountered. My only complaints are minor. They do not provide wash cloths and the breakfast buffet varies very little from day-to-day. The staff is excellent. There was a issue with my reservation. I arrived after midnight and they could not

title: Clean and tidy great location
desc: For our recent stop in Singapore we opted to use the Carlton Hotel Singapore as our base. The hotel is in a great spot with easy access to MRT and bus stops to get you around. Walking is also an option however the miles soon start to add up, combined with the heat it's best to try and utalise the transport to lighten the load on the feet. I was a little disappointed upon check in as there was queues. It seemed that Air crew, particularly Cathay Pacific staff stood out, taking priority, not necessarily the hotels fault as they seemed quite rude, pushy and demanding. I would recommend introducing an airline only check in to get them in line. We experienced this issue a number of times. A very poor reflection on Cathay Pacific staff specifically. The room was clean and tidy

title: Very handy location.
desc: We had 4 nights here in 1319 and very lucky to get an early check-in as we arrived pretty early into Singapore. The room and beds were pretty good but the tv was somewhat limited to what you can watch with no Netflix or Prime but did try to cast from my device but didn't quite work. The staff were very good and nothing was a problem for them.

title: My top hotel choice in Singapore - special mention to Duty Managers Rafi and S.Waran
desc: Carlton Hotel offers the best value in Singapore with its location, room size, amenities, and service. It's the only hotel that I choose to stay in Singapore. Location: Prime spot right next to City Hall MRT station and lots of bus stops to travel around the city. MRT station connected to shopping mall with McDonalds (24-hour opening on weekends). Lots of F&B choices around. Location is unbeatable. Room: Clean and huge room with modern decor. Fantastic panoramic view of the city skyline from both the room and bathroom. Awesome, spacious bathroom size with bathtub overlooking the skyline and spacious shower area too. Daily housekeeping makes the room smell great and corridors smell pleasant too. In-room amenities are aplenty. Nightly bath soaks overlooking the night skyline

title: Great hotel
desc: Great hotel have stayed there many times. Close to everything can walk to many places. Also the MRT station very close. if you do not want to walk any where. Breakfast fantastic with a very good selection.

title: Great stay BUT Disappointed
desc: First time Carlton, friends with us been many times. The hotel was good, clean, location was perfect, staff were great. We booked Executive Club room and we all were somewhat disappointed. I took it upon my self to review my stay via email to the General Manager, Mr Ware. I am very disappointed that there was no acknowledgement or reply.

title: Great stay at the Carlton
desc: Everyone in the hotel was very kind and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the location great! Always love to visit Singapore and stay at the Carlton! Across the stress is a big mall where you can get everything you need.

title: First time in Singapore on honeymoon
desc: Very efficient check in and check out! Very grateful for our free upgraded room and cake due to it being our honeymoon! The views over the city were amazing! Staff very friendly and helpful. Room very comfortable and clean! Great location! Would 100 perfect stay again

title: Good Business hotel
desc: A very good business hotel very good location absolutely neat and clean Rooms a good sizes only minus is this is a very old property rest all is good even breakfast is also good . Had visited 4 years back also in this hotel and prefer bcoz of location.

title: Cafe Mosaic - Buffet Lunch
desc: Cafe Mosaic The food is nice and environment is nice, the manager (Wan Ping) also recommended some good places to visit. The variety of food available also caters to the taste buds of many people, would highly recommend this place!

title: Horrible stay here! Damaged baby item
desc: Stayed here 1 night for a layover in transit to Bali. The hotel was recommended to me by a friend and it definitely did not stand up to its name. First the outlets in the room didn’t work and it took hours for someone to come and fix them. When they finally came they fixed it and i advised them i have a baby bottle sterilizer and they told me it was okay to plug it in. Never was told that i never a transformer to plug it in to the outlet by maintenance. I ended up having to call again because the outlets once again were not working and my phone was dying and i had a very early flight. They sent maintenance there again and this time my entire baby bottle sterilizer fuse blew out because of the faulty outlet and maintenance not advising me that there are two different types of

title: A place for great customer service
desc: Customer service was remarkable with great attention to detail by staff. Very pleasant and welcoming stay. Chai in the lounge gave exceptional service and would definitely stay again providing they open the Premier side of the hotel 😊

title: wonderful travel experience
desc: I'm from Taiwan, and it's my first time to travel freely in Singapore. Singapore is a beautiful country. We stayed here for six days and stayed at the Carlton Hotel. The hotel’s breakfast was varied and delicious. The room quality was very good. The room was large and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were comfortable. In particular, the front desk service staff of the hotel: Nabihan is very good, because he is familiar with Chinese and provided us with a lot of assistance, thank you very much! This is a wonderful travel experience. If we have the opportunity to come to Singapore in the future, we will choose to stay at Carlton Hotel again.

title: Excellent hotel
desc: Very kind and helpful person concierge Suresh! He help me very much to resolve some problem. And also all the people in charge at the reception.the restaurant menu very various and good also breakfast. Thanks to everybody

title: It is a great hotel to be in during an emergency.
desc: The staff at Carlton were the best to deal when my husband needed medical attention, on our last day in Singapore. The concierge attended to my husband, and organised the ambulance to take us to the hospital. On our return, we found that the room was already make up, and we were given the use of the room, free of charge, until 8.00pm that evening. In addition, the concierge and management could not do enough for us. If and when we return to Singapore for our next holiday, we will definitely stay at the Carlton Hotel again.

title: Great hotel unless you are a smoker!!
desc: We booked this hotel purely on its location as we needed to be near to where our daughter lived. It was not our first choice and we were a little anxious given how much cheaper it was than our other choices. Our concerns were totally unfounded, this was a really nice hotel and the staff do what ever they can to assist. Breakfast is good and if you don't have time to sit down then there is an excellent coffee bar/bakery in the hotel as well. The pool is lovely, although it could do with adding some more sun beds, and the gym had everything you could need. Our room was not huge but it was more than adequate and the bathroom was extremely large with both a huge bath and a massive walk in rain shower. So why the 4 star review? Well for me there was one major fault with the hotel

title: Good hotel in a descent location
desc: Good hotel in a fairly good location. Close to the subways. Chimjes across the road which offers multiple restaurants. The rooms in the premier tower is of good size but my view wasn’t all that great. The rooms are clean, fully functional (except no outlets by the bed to charge your phone), the bed was comfortable. I wouldn’t hesitate to come back if the price is right.

title: Average stay, great location, will try somewhere else
desc: Pluses 1. Unbeatable location 2. Got a complimentary upgrade to premier wing 3. Generously sized, luxurious room (premier wing) 4. Nice view of Chijmes Minuses 1. Hot water was lacking during peak hours - from 0700 to 1000 hrs, I took 2 showers in tepid water 2. Breakfast spread is standard but underwhelming 3. Expensive

title: Hotel staff was very helpful specially Mr Victor at Concierge was just brilliant in every way 👏
desc: Very comfortable bed and pillows and room. Breakfast was excellent. The hotel is well situated and is easy walking distance from Marina Bay. Gym and swimming pools are adequate with spa facilities on 5th floor. Chinese restaurant is also very good early booking recommended.

title: Ok
desc: Good location, and spacious room with a nice view. An odd scent in the room intitially, but it gradually went away. Not very practical shower solution, with too cold water mixed with bursts of scolding hot, to keep us on our toes. Comfortable beds, but a a bit too much noise from the elevators, where our room was located. Pool area was nice and tidy, but the kids found the water to be too cold. I can agree. Nice breakfast, with lots to choose from. An ok hotel experience.

title: Fabulous service and staff!
desc: We were so impressed with the friendliness and excellent service of all the staff, for all of our five day stay! From the front door staff who organized our taxis to the front desk and restaurants. Nothing was too much trouble and they were always smiling and friendly. Our room was spacious and spotless. The staff attitude really added to the enjoyment of our trip.

title: Great Hotel
desc: Check inn was great no wait. This is a large well positioned hotel next to Raffles and across the road is raffles plaza shopping mall, with access to many eating outlets. room size was good, lovely bathrooms with all the amenities met. Housekeeping was of a high standard. Breakfast was good lots to choose from. location is perfect. bus and metro so close we had no problem using both. We had a bit of a problem on checking out and the staff handled the matter in a most professional way and made us feel at ease. We would definitely stay again on our return to Singapore. I probably would not book directly with the hotel, but rather through a third party as there was a slight problem with our booking price and what we ended up paying. This hotel is however well priced for Singapore

title: Large hotel without the ambience of pthers
desc: Arrived and took nearly half an hour to be booked in. The person at the counter clearly had no idea what was happening.I understand training but have someone with knowledge with them. The room was adequate, but had an old welcome gift on arrival with another persons name on it. A view of an air conditioner was not was expected. The pool had no life guard and a run down bar that appears to not have functioned for a while. The food at the restaurant was good and plenty full. A lot of Asian meals not really catering for all. The staff though efficient were at times overly keen to take your plate even though you had not finished. Security at the hotel I rate as fair. Many people can walk in and enter the lift at any time. The hotel was central to the main CBA but offered nothing in

title: Peek-a-boo fireworks!
desc: We booked this hotel for a family staycation over Singapore National Day Aug 9. We had 2 rooms on 11th floor and 1 room on the 14th floor. We were able to see the, Red Lions, fly pass, fighter jets, even partial view of the spectator stands/screen at the padang. As for the fireworks, we were blocked by Raffles City but had a peekaboo partial view. The location is unbeatable, close to shopping, food. Everyone was happy. Special thanks to front desk Suren & Darumita for being accommodating. We had a memorable stay!

title: Great Location
desc: We stayed here for a Stopover en route back to the UK. We booked 2 rooms (10th & 15th floor). Never stayed there before but were familiar with the area as we have stayed in several close-by hotels previously. The Carlton was really good and we're glad we made the booking. Comfortable and clean. The staff were very helpful. Rooms were quiet and ours had a terrific view of the city. Excellent location for shopping and dining. We didn't eat there as there were so many options close-by (Raffles City, Chijmes etc). Would definitely recommend staying here in the future.

title: A mediocre hotel in the heart of the city
desc: A mediocre hotel in the heart of a bustling part of the city. It’s a business hotel (it never shies away from this, just for review awareness purposes), so in the main it’s clean, efficient and does what it says on the tin. Offers a 5th floor open roof swimming pool - complete with ragged towels for guests and the service received has left us wanting; I wouldn’t mention anyone by name as people have bad days and committing to the internet isn’t fair - but what I would say is check out staff for us were dismissive, curt and impolite (if the establishment would like further details, happy to provide on request for feedback and service improvement). You’re therefore not really paying for the service or quality of the amenities - but a no-frills night stay. Location though is

title: Nabihan from Carlton Hotel :-)
desc: Nabihan was super super friendly, he made my second time here at the hotel such a pleasant one. Honestly i had such a wholesome conversation with him, and he’s service was super amazing. 11/10 for a guy like him whom does his job with so much passion and love, WILL DEFINITELY COME AND STAY HERE AGAIN 🥹 he’s such a sweetie!!!!!

title: Lovely hotel, great location
desc: Nabihan was so welcoming and professional. I stayed here a decade ago and it’s great to be back! The location is great and there’s a lot to do in the area. The views are beautiful too and service is great.

title: Singapore Stopover.
desc: Great location, service, amenities and food. We had lovely views from our room. We were upgraded for no charge. The pool area, though small, was with planning, useful to swim in. Sometimes there were kids in the pool, but one would expect that. The breakfasts were splendid.

title: Great location
desc: Location was good. Room was a good size. Close to MRT station. Raffles Hotel was just across the road. Breakfast selection had a lot of choices, things you could have that you normally wouldn’t. Don’t provide face washer. Our view was of the water tank. We did have an issue with the shower not draining and water overflowing from the shower. Informed the staff and it was fixed that day.

title: Nice hotel, poor breakfast
desc: I have been a customer of this hotel for many many years. Sadly it has gone downhill, and the breakfast is now at rock bottom. The tables are so closely packed, that I was actually unable to get in or out without asking someone to get out of their seats. There were queues for the single toaster, queues for the coffee machines. The quality of the food was seriously poor. Rubbish cheap orange juice, cheap sliced bread, processed cheese and so on, I couldn't even recognise the yogurt as such it was some watered down version. The breakfasts used to be a highlight of this hotel, not any more, this was my third visit since covid. It's not going to go back to what it was.. avoid

title: No loyalty
desc: This is a decent hotel overall, but I'm surprised that returning customers/loyalty isn't rewarded. I spent over a month in the other Carlton last year, and on this trip I can't get an early check-in or even lounge access for the 3 hours I need to wait for the room to be ready. Really surprising.

title: Look elsewhere
desc: Rooms are completely underwhelming with poor amenities. No coffee machine, cheap tea and instant coffee, no drinking glasses. Really super disappointing for a high rated hotel in Singapore. Beds are hard, wouldn’t not recommend based on intitial experience.

title: Goodyear Locación. Neat place.
desc: Nice place. Well located Its a ver clean, centrally located place. Clase to a few Shopping centre. Breackfest has a largo variety of selección in fruits, bread., algo Asían breackfest. Staff is ver friendly.

title: 100% +++ satisfaction to Carlton Hotel Singapore
desc: Check in and out are super easy. All customer service are well trained and professional. Very warmth and welcoming. Cleaning crew for the rooms is very polite and well trained. Quick response when calling for luggage helpers.

title: Stayed to view the main sites in Singapore city.
desc: Location of the hotel is across the street from Raffles and was perfect to pop in for a Singapore Sling and to to tour the city. Breakfast set us up for the day with the egg station cooking your eggs just the way you like. There is a swimming pool on the fifth floor with great views. Could have done with a bar on the ground floor for an evening night cap.

title: Great place to stay
desc: The only thing nicer than the rooms and facilities, is the staff. Friendly, helpful and mindful. Comviently located. We can walk everywhere, and in the event that something is a bit further, taxis are inexpensive and plentiful. Recommend highly.

title: One of the nice hotel in Singapore
desc: The hotel is clean and all the staff is so nice. Having good location and easy to get to the most of spots. We'd like to definitely recommend Carlton hotel to our firends that plan to visit Singapore.
